Package chess.model.player

Class HumanPlayer

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.player.Player
chess.model.player.HumanPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
public final class HumanPlayer extends Player
A concrete subtype of Player that represents a human player that makes move via a user interface.

The workflow is as follows:

  1. A human player interacts with a user interface;
  2. The user interface interprets and registers the player's move by calling registerNextMove(Position, Position);
  3. The user interface invokes ChessGame.nextTurn() which queries the HumanPlayer object for the next move by calling getPlayerMove(Chessboard).
Hence, the call to ChessGame.nextTurn() must be preceded by a call to the method registerNextMove(Position, Position).
See Also:

  • ChessGame

  • Constructor Details

    • HumanPlayer

      public HumanPlayer(String name, Color color, int score)
      Constructs this player with a name, color, and an initial score.

      Note: The player's name must not be empty or contains spaces only.

      Parameters:
      name - The non-empty name of the player.
      color - The color of the player.
      score - The initial score of the player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayerMove

      public PlayerMove getPlayerMove(Chessboard chessboard)
      Returns the registered next move and resets the next move to null.

      Note: Any call to this method must be preceded by an appropriate call to registerNextMove(Position, Position) to ensure a move has been registered.

      Specified by:
      getPlayerMove in class Player
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard.
      Returns:
      A PlayerMove object that describes the human player's move.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If no next move was registered.

    • registerNextMove

      public void registerNextMove(Position initialPosition, Position finalPosition)
      Registers the next move for this human player.
      Parameters:
      initialPosition - The initial position of the move.
      finalPosition - The final position of the move.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
